summary: The Improving Access to Nutrition Act of 2025 seeks to amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 by repealing the work requirements for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). The bill highlights findings related to hunger and food insecurity, particularly exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic, and focuses on the program's vital role in supporting vulnerable populations. It amends sections of the Food and Nutrition Act and other relevant legislation to eliminate the work requirement and related provisions, with an effective date 180 days after enactment.
